docs.abstract: Clearly, weight loss is an intense struggle, one in which we are not fighting simply hunger or cravings for sweets, but our own bodies.
docs.lead_paragraph: In this week's New York Times Magazine, I explore new research that helps explain why most dieters who lose weight end up gaining it all back.
docs.snippet: Clearly, weight loss is an intense struggle, one in which we are not fighting simply hunger or cravings for sweets, but our own bodies.

docs.abstract: Andrew Adam Newman Advertising column observes that with Medicare set to start reimbursing physicians for obesity treatment in January, a new campaign is directing ads both at patients and at doctors.

headline.main: Life Expectancy for Babies Climbs to Record Level in City

docs.abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg announces that the life expectancy for babies born in New York City reached 80.6 years in 2009, the highest level recorded and one that surpasses the national life expectancy rate; life expectancy for 40-year-olds in the city also increased, to 82 years in 2009 from 79.5 years in 2000, a gain of 2.5 years, compared with an increase of 1.2 years for the same age group nationwide. Photo (M)/
docs.lead_paragraph: The life expectancy for babies born in New York City reached 80.6 years in 2009, the highest level recorded and one that surpasses the national life expectancy rate, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said Tuesday. Life expectancy at birth in the city has increased nearly three years since 2000; the latest figure is more than two years higher than the most recently reported national rate, 78.2 years.
docs.snippet: The life expectancy for babies born in New York City reached 80.6 years in 2009, the highest level recorded and one that surpasses the national life expectancy rate, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said Tuesday.     Life expectancy at birth in the city...

docs.abstract: Ross Douthat Op-Ed column argues that there is a dearth of constructive social policy aimed at helping families with children; asserts that giving women generous maternity leaves and expanding the child tax credit to ease the burden on parents with young children would be a start in the right direction.
